content.description: This climb often sends un-aware climbers into fits! Zig left then Zag right then Zig left again.
content.location: Walk to top of trail where you will find a big bolder next to remains of the Billy Mitchel telegraph line. Just above this you will find a small dirt platform carved into the slope. Move up and left through small rock step and belay there. Shares same first bolt And anchor as Jah works.

content.description: Climb up Muffin Touch but instead of heading out onto face head up into hand crack. Belay from spruce tree up top.
content.protection: Standard rack belay at spruce tree up top
content.location: Walk to top of trail where you will find a big bolder next to remains of the Billy Mitchel telegraph line. Just above this you will find a small dirt platform carved into the slope. Start up crack feature.

content.description: If only it was 100ft longer! Glorious stemming in a corner.
content.location: Walk to top of trail where you will find a big bolder next to remains of the Billy Mitchel telegraph line. Just above this you will find a small dirt platform carved into the slope. Move left from here and up over two small rock steps and into obvious right facing corner.

content.description: Pleasant climbing leads to increased difficulty.
content.location: After you switch back on the approach trail begin to look up and left. Pony Express is the first climb you will see and sits by itself.

content.description: Start up crack and move right onto nice face climbing to anchor.
content.location: Walk to top of trail where you will find a big bolder next to remains of the Billy Mitchel telegraph line. Just above this you will find a small dirt platform carved into the slope. Climb up crack with bolt next to it. Furthest right climb on Upper Wall

content.description: Straight forward climbing leads to hard crux through small roof and more tricky face climbing.
content.location: Walk to top of trail where you will find a big bolder next to remains of the Billy Mitchel telegraph line. Just above this you will find a small dirt platform carved into the slope. Move up and left through small rock step and belay there. Shares same first bolt and anchors as Zig-Zag.

content.description: A great cluster of climbs with something for everyone, from 5.8 to 5.11.
